problems.title: Select All User Names
problems.description: Retrieve all user names from the users table.
problems.explanation: Simple SELECT statement to retrieve a single column.

problems.title: Get Top 3 Youngest Users
problems.description: Find the 3 youngest users by sorting on age.
problems.solution:
SELECT name, age
FROM users
ORDER BY age ASC
LIMIT 3;
problems.explanation: ORDER BY sorts the results, and LIMIT restricts to the first 3 rows.

problems.title: Calculate Age in Months
problems.description: For each user, show their name, age, and age in months (age * 12).
problems.solution:
SELECT 
    name,
    age,
    age * 12 AS age_in_months
FROM users;
problems.explanation: Use arithmetic operations and AS to create calculated columns with meaningful names.

problems.title: Categorize Users by Age and Premium Status
problems.description: Create a report showing user names with age categories ('Young', 'Adult', 'Senior') and a premium label.
problems.solution:
SELECT 
    name,
    age,
    CASE 
        WHEN age < 27 THEN 'Young'
        WHEN age < 32 THEN 'Adult'
        ELSE 'Senior'
    END AS age_category,
    CASE 
        WHEN premium = true THEN '‚≠ê Premium'
        ELSE 'Standard'
    END AS account_type
FROM users
ORDER BY age;
problems.explanation: CASE statements create conditional logic for categorization, essential for creating features in ML pipelines.

problems.title: Complex User Segmentation
problems.description: Create a user segmentation report with custom sorting: Premium users first, then by country (USA first), then by age descending.
problems.solution:
SELECT 
    name,
    country,
    age,
    premium,
    CASE 
        WHEN premium = true THEN 'VIP'
        WHEN age > 30 THEN 'Potential VIP'
        ELSE 'Standard'
    END AS segment
FROM users
ORDER BY 
    CASE WHEN premium = true THEN 1 ELSE 2 END,
    CASE WHEN country = 'USA' THEN 1 ELSE 2 END,
    age DESC;
problems.explanation: Complex sorting with multiple CASE expressions allows custom ordering logic, useful for prioritizing records in ML feature extraction.
